definition: to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳進河裏了，但小內德畏縮不前。

sentences.english: German banks are balking at writing off Greek debt.
sentences.chinese: 德國各家銀行在勾銷希臘債務方面畏縮不前。

sentences.english: The dog cringed at the sight of the whip.
Did we brave all then to falter now?
sentences.chinese: 當時我們英勇奮鬥，今天卻要畏縮不前嗎？

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river, but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩都跳下河了，但小內德畏縮不前。

sentences.english: Have you ever held back on doing something because you were afraid of failure?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾因爲害怕失敗而畏縮不前？

sentences.english: Thou wilt not cower in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 你不會含屈忍辱畏縮不前。

sentences.english: He said he could swim, but he backed down when we got to the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他說他會泅水，但是等咱們到了湖邊他卻畏縮不前了。

sentences.english: The dog cringed at the sight of a snake.
sentences.chinese: 那條狗看見了一條蛇便畏縮不前。

sentences.english: The coward quai- led before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 這個懦夫在敵人面前畏縮不前。

sentences.english: He always funked when competition grew too keen.
sentences.chinese: 在競爭太激烈時他總是畏縮不前。

sentences.english: He cowered when he saw all of the TV cameras.
sentences.chinese: 看到了四周的電視攝像機，他有些畏縮不前。

sentences.english: Follow your heart. It's wiser than you think. And for God's sake don't be scared.
sentences.chinese: 跟隨着心的方向，不要畏縮不前，這纔是明智的做法。

sentences.english: We can't afford to have anyone in this enterprise who is likely to turn yellow when the testing-time comes.
sentences.chinese: 我們的企業不能僱用在考驗關頭可能畏縮不前的人。

sentences.english: The coward quailed before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 這個懦夫在敵人面前畏縮不前。
